page.title: 12PITSFORD CONVENT
page.content: THIS CONVENT WAS FOUNDED IN 1947 BY AN ORDER OF NUNS KNOWN AS "THE HOLY FAMILY OF NAZARETH". IT WAS DESIGNED TO CATER FOR THE NEEDS OF POLISH CHILDREN ARRIVING IN THIS AREA OF ENGLAND IN THE AFTERMATH OF THE 1939-1945 WAR IN EUROPE. THE PRIMARY FUNCTION OF THE CONVENT WAS AS A BOARDING SCHOOL WHOSE ROLL NUMBERS VARIED BETWEEN 100 AND 200 CHILDREN. ALL WERE TAUGHT ACADEMIC SUBJECTS IN THE POLISH LANGUAGE. PRODUCE, IN THE FORM OF FRUIT, FLOWERS AND VEGETABLES HAVE ALWAYS BEEN GROWN IN THE EXTENSIVE CONVENT GARDENS. SINCE 1965 THE SISTERS HAVE PROVIDED A SATURDAY SCHOOL FOR CHILDREN OF POLISH EXTRACTION WHO LIVE IN THE AREA AND WISH TO LEARN THE POLISH LANGUAGE. BOARDING EDUCATION IS NO LONGER AVAILABLE BUT THE TWELVE RESIDENT SISTERS CONTINUE THEIR EDUCATION ROLE.
